{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3556928,"name":"Ertu","username":"FRC_Member_apex","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/e480ec/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T13:38:23.682Z","cooked":"

Hello, so we have a limelight 4 that we are trying to setup. our code for the limelight does not work. we are trying to make it so that it lines up with the reef. we are using it with a pigeon 2.0. I have attached our code (we are using a timed robot).
Robot.java (9.9 KB)

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-14T13:39:32.940Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":60.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495557,"topic_slug":"limelight-code-not-working","display_username":"Ertu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"/uploads/short-url/j2zc8cxdZzkTZjpI3O1BEwUa8u.java","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/limelight-help/495576/2","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Limelight Help","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-code-not-working/495557/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556944,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T13:57:44.737Z","cooked":"

What doesn’t work? How does it behave differently than what you want or expect?

I see you imported the WPILib PIDController but then reinvented it with your own code. It’s easier to troubleshoot if you use known good code.

I don’t see how you know when to stop driving. Apparently you release the button to stop (except you stop automatically if you are too far away).

Edit Sorry I got the Ta usage backwards - it stops when the tag is big.

You have both the arcade drive from the joystick and the button press drive used at the same time. They conflict. If you press the button then don’t use the arcade drive - if() then{} else{}

btw we don’t have an encoder and are using a pigeon 2.0, is that fine for limelight?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-14T15:02:43.031Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":25,"readers_count":24,"score":10.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495557,"topic_slug":"limelight-code-not-working","display_username":"Ertu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":"Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.","can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-code-not-working/495557/8","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3557092,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T16:47:16.002Z","cooked":"

If you have an actual very high LL framerate, then you don’t need to use the gyro (as you have not used in your code) but normally you get better accuracy and performance by using the gyro in the PID controller and using the LL Tx angle to set the setpoint of the PID controller.

You stop the auto alignment by PID controllers when you are close enough to the tag but you didn’t check to make sure you were ALSO pointing at the target. You would want both criteria to be met before stopping.
